renderpass.code:
/*

This shader is for studying precision and interactively navigating the Mandelbrot set.

MOUSE & KEYBOARD controls:

MOVE: click to center a point  -OR-  arrow keys
ZOOM: z/x                      -OR-  shift + up/down

dec/Inc iterations:             i/I   
dec/Inc samples-per-pixel:      s/S   
toggle display of coordinates:  d
RESET view:                     r    (also resets samples & iterations)
cycle predefined views:         v    (some are blocky; at the limit of precision - zoom out a bit)

There is a small safe/dead click zone in the bottom left corner 
So you can click (focus the window) without moving the view.

Apologies in advance for any/all problems:
This shader is strictly WebGL 2, it will give compile errors in WebGL 1 browsers.
This shader might be pretty slow on mobile or older GPUs.
This shader can be extremely slow for higher iterations and pixel sample counts.
If the rendering takes too long, the shader will crash.
There are still some artifacts due to a bug or two in my double-precision math code.
I don't know if the buffer state code works in all GPUs & browsers.

Partly inspired by https://www.shadertoy.com/view/XdsXWN, which can get better than double precision.

*/

void mainImage( out vec4 fragColor, in vec2 fragCoord )
{
    fragColor   = vec4(0.);
    vec4 mandel = texelFetch(iChannel0, ivec2(fragCoord), 0);
    vec4 hud    = texelFetch(iChannel1, ivec2(fragCoord), 0);
    fragColor   = comp(mandel, premult(hud));
}
